@tha_nickscape_guy wrote:

Haste: No, this isn’t other people’s work. Maybe i have seen a guide about this and stuff but NO I don’t think this is other people’s work. Yes EVERYONE tells me in ALL of my tuts that it’s common sense and i’m really tired of that… . Anyways Haste i’m just trying to help people and I enjoy making these tuts. So please note: This is NOT a try to steal other people’s work i’m just trying to help :(. If that annoys you please don’t post hate reply’s :(. Thanks.

Dastan: Thank you :D! Finally a really nice comment! Thank you!

item.title: [317] How to make a portal/object teleport you [317]
item.dc:creator: @tha_nickscape_guy tha nickscape guy
item.description:
@tha_nickscape_guy wrote:

Hi everyone!
This is how to make a portal/an object teleport you to somewhere
Difficulty: 1/10, maybe 2/10, for begginers idk :D.
Files edited: Client.java [size=10pt]ONLY
Let’s get started!
Open up client.java
Search for:

makeglobalobject

You should see something like…

[code] public void NewObjects() {

    makeGlobalObject(3246, 3792, 4876, 0, 10); // magic stall
    makeGlobalObject(3160, 3722, 4876, 0, 10); // magic stall
    makeGlobalObject(3159, 3722, 4876, 0, 10); // magic stall
    makeGlobalObject(3158, 3722, 4876, 0, 10); // magic stall
    makeGlobalObject(3490, 3091, 516, 2, 10);//lamp
makeGlobalObject(3490, 3090, 516, 2, 10);//lamp
makeGlobalObject(3490, 3089, 516, 2, 10);//lamp
    makeGlobalObject(3248, 3793, 1276, -1, 10); // regtree
    makeGlobalObject(3234, 2914, 2783, -3, 10);// Anvil
    makeGlobalObject(3234, 2916, 2783, -3, 10);// Anvil
    makeGlobalObject(3229, 2916, 2781, 0, 10);// Furnac
makeGlobalObject(3234, 2920, 2111, 0, 10);//ore
makeGlobalObject(3222, 2917, 8151, 0, 10);//farming
makeGlobalObject(3234, 2919, 2111, 0, 10);//ore
    makeGlobalObject(3230, 2924, 3816, -2, 10);// Kitchen Drawers
    makeGlobalObject(3233, 2923, 2287, 0, 10);// Obstacle Pipe
    makeGlobalObject(3228, 2912, 4172, -1, 10); // Range
    makeGlobalObject(3232, 2908, 2213, 0, 10); // bank
    makeGlobalObject(3233, 2908, 2213, 0, 10); // bank
    makeGlobalObject(3224, 2913, 4877, 1, 10); // general stall
    makeGlobalObject(3222, 2913, 4876, 0, 10); // magic stall
    makeGlobalObject(3222, 2920, 2562, 1, 10); // gem stall
    makeGlobalObject(3222, 2914, 4878, 0, 10); // scimitar stall
    makeGlobalObject(3222, 2923, 2565, 0, 10); // silver stall
    makeGlobalObject(3227, 2924, 2560, 0, 10); // silk stall
    makeGlobalObject(3231, 2922, 1276, -1, 10); // regtree[/code]

Scroll all the way down and add this:

        makeGlobalObject(YOUR OBJECTS X, YOUR OBJECTS Y, OBJECT, 0, 10);//JUST IGNORE THE 0 AND 10

Ok now you’ve added your object!
Now we have to make it teleport you to somewhere ;).

Search for:

object click one

You should see something like this:

[code] /* OBJECT CLICK ONE*/

public void objectClick(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int face2, int GateID) {

    if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("admin")) {
        println_debug(
                "atObject: " + objectX + "," + objectY + " objectID: "
                + objectID);
    } 

    switch (objectID) {

    // QUEST_1 OBJECTS
    case 4499:
        if (objectX == 2797 && objectY == 3614) {
            sendMessage("You crawl through the cave");
            teleportToX = 2772;
            teleportToY = 10231;
        }
        break;
    case 4408:
        if (objectX == 2436 && objectY == 3089) {
            sendMessage("Welcome to Castle Wars!");
            teleportToX = 2425;
            teleportToY = 3105;
        }
        break;[/code]

Ok the case is normally the object or item ID your using.
So now we have to add a portal (or anything other that you want to teleport you somewhere).
Under one of the

break;

's you add this…

case ####://HERE YOU ADD THE YOUR OBJECT'S ID if (objectX == #### && objectY == ####) {//HERE YOU ADD WHERE YOUR OBJECT X AND Y IS sendMessage("YOUR MESSAGE");//YOUR MESSAGE teleportToX = ####;//WHERE YOUR PORTAL TELEPORTS YOU TO. THE X COORD teleportToY = ####;//WHERE YOUR PORTAL TELEPORTS YOU TO. THE Y COORD } break;
[size=12pt]COMPILE AND RESTART YOUR SERVER![/size]
[size=14pt]Congratulations! Your done :D!![/size]
[size=14pt]Any questions or errors? Post them in a reply! :D.[/size]
